name: ambidextrous
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to use both hands equally well: I am naturally left-handed, but was not allowed to write with my left hand, with the result that I became ambidextrous. He is a promising, ambidextrous young golfer.
designed to be used both by people who are left-handed (= using the left hand to write and do most things) and those who are right-handed (= using the right hand most): The ambidextrous design means the mouse is great for lefties or righties. There is an ambidextrous thumb lever on both sides of the hand grip.
able to do two or more different things equally well: Working in today's media calls for ambidextrous multitasking. They suggest that, in order to successfully innovate while maintaining the performance of the core business, organizations need to be "ambidextrous". Synonym
versatile
More examplesFewer examplesFew of us are naturally ambidextrous but this can be achieved in karate technique through training.He broke his right arm as a child, and has now become surprisingly ambidextrous.Why shouldn't there be ambidextrous cricketers who can bat, bowl and throw with either hand?
